feed.title: Track Awesome Fp Js Updates Weekly
feed.subtitle: :sunglasses: A curated list of awesome functional programming stuff in js

entry.title: Awesome Fp Js Updates on Jun 09 - Jun 15, 2025
entry.content:
Resources / Articles

  • A Monad in Practicality: First-Class Failures ‚Äì A walk through some practical use cases for specific monadic structures in JavaScript: use the Maybe monad to handle simple failure cases and model more complex scenarios with the Either monad or the Validation applicative functor.
entry.summary: 1 awesome projects updated on Jun 09 - Jun 15, 2025

entry.title: Awesome Fp Js Updates on Oct 10 - Oct 16, 2022
entry.content:
Libraries

  • ts-pattern (‚≠ê14k) - The exhaustive Pattern Matching library for TypeScript, with smart type inference. Pattern Matching is a code-branching technique coming from FP languages.

Libraries / Data Structures

  • List (‚≠ê1.7k) - An extremely fast immutable list with a comprehensive functional API. Designed to seamlessly integrate with Ramda (‚≠ê1.7k).

entry.content:
Resources / Articles

  • You don't (may not) need loops ‚ûø (‚≠ê1.2k) - Loops are one of the first constructs that junior programmers learn, but they can pose many potential issues in the software development process, and could be avoided in many cases.
entry.summary: 1 awesome projects updated on Feb 17 - Feb 23, 2020

entry.title: Awesome Fp Js Updates on Nov 25 - Dec 01, 2019
entry.content:
Libraries

  • Ramda (‚≠ê24k) ‚Äì A practical functional library for JavaScript that is designed specifically for a functional programming style. A style that makes it easy to create functional pipelines and never mutates user data. +TS.
  • Folktale ‚Äì A standard library for functional programming in JavaScript. Typescript support expected mid-2020. -TS.
  • lodash/fp (‚≠ê61k) ‚Äì An instance of Lodash (‚≠ê61k) with its methods wrapped to produce immutable, auto-curried, iteratee-first, data-last methods. +TS.
  • 101 (‚≠ê1.5k) ‚Äì A modern and modular JavaScript utility library made to work well with vanilla JavaScript methods. -TS
  • barely-functional (‚≠ê107) ‚Äì A tiny (2.7kb) functional programming library using native ES5/6 operations. -TS.
  • prelude.ls ‚Äì A functionally oriented utility library somewhat based off of Haskell's Prelude module. -TS.
  • preludejs (‚≠ê100) - Hardcore Functional Programming for JavaScript. -TS.
  • 1-liners (‚≠ê796) ‚Äì Functional tools that couldn‚Äôt be simpler. A dead simple functional utility belt, hand-crafted with love and attention. -TS.
  • funfix (‚≠ê632) ‚Äì Funfix is a library of type classes and data types for Functional Programming in JavaScript, TypeScript and Flow. +CT, +TS.
  • pico-lambda (‚≠ê71) - Arrays, Strings and things the functional way. A 640b functional library based on native methods. -TS.
  • pareto-js (‚≠ê258) - An extremely small, intuitive and fast functional utility library for JavaScript -TS.
  • fpEs (‚≠ê43) - A small library provides simple usages of basic FP & pattern-matching/sumtype & MonadIO/Rx & Optional for Javascript. -TS.
  • Creed ‚Äì Sophisticated and functionally-minded async with advanced features: coroutines, promises, ES2015 iterables, fantasy-land. -TS.
  • TGrid (‚≠ê162) - Grid Computing Framework, Network & Thread extension of TSTL (‚≠ê615), supporting RFC (Remote Function Call). +TS.
  • Ferrum (‚≠ê530) ‚Äì Iterator library with support for objects as iterables, lazy evaulation andpipe(); implements Traits (from Rust)/Type Classes (from Haskell) in JS. -TS.
  • iter-tools (‚≠ê177) - a rich toolset for working with iterables, both sync and async. +TS.
  • remeda A function library roughly subsetting Ramda, but written in Typescript and thus more type-friendly. +TS.

Libraries / Data Structures

  • Immer (‚≠ê28k) ‚Äì Immer is a tiny package for immutable state based on copy-on-write mechanism. +TS.
  • DerivableJS (‚≠ê516) ‚Äì Functional Reactive State for JavaScript and TypeScript. DerivableJS enables you to make elegant declarative statements about how your bits of state are related. +TS.
  • collectable (‚≠ê274) ‚Äì Super high-performance immutable data structures for modern JavaScript and TypeScript applications. +TS.
  • prelude.ts (‚≠ê382) - Immutable persistent collections, functional constructs such as Option and Either, and combinators. Implemented in Typescript but supports javascript too. +CT, +TS.
  • TSTL (‚≠ê615) - C++ STL (Standard Template Library) is implemented in TypeScript. STL Containers, iterators, algorithms and functors, that following functional programming rule, are provided. +TS.

Libraries / Algebraic Data Types

  • Sanctuary (‚≠ê3.1k) ‚Äì Sanctuary makes it possible to write safe code without null checks. +CT, +TS.
  • monet.js ‚Äì A library that assists functional programming by providing a rich set of Monads and other useful functions. +CT, +TS.
  • crocks (‚≠ê1.6k) ‚Äì A collection of popular Algebraic Data Types with the main goal to curate and provide not only a common interface between each type, but also all of the helper functions needed to hit the ground running. -TS.
  • purify (‚≠ê1.6k) - Functional programming library for TypeScript focusing on ADTs. +CT, +TS.
  • Pratica (‚≠ê484) - Small, simple, easy FP data types for pragmatic and productive developers who need to ship reliable code fast. +CT, +TS.
  • Tifi - Tifi is a library for functional programming in TypeScript. It solves a problem of the existence of both undefined and null. Tifi is inspired by the OCaml/Reason utilities for the option data type. +CT, +TS.
entry.summary: 28 awesome projects updated on Nov 25 - Dec 01, 2019

entry.title: Awesome Fp Js Updates on Jun 05 - Jun 11, 2017
entry.content:
Libraries

  • Javascript Parser Combinator (‚≠ê148) ‚Äì Javascript parser combinator implementation inspired by the Haskell's Parsec
  • fun-task (‚≠ê373) ‚Äì An abstraction for managing asynchronous code in JS. Tasks are similar to Promises with the key difference that Tasks can represent a computation while Promises can represent only the results of a computation. Ships with Flow type definitions.
  • most (‚≠ê3.5k) ‚Äì Ultra-high performance reactive programming to help you compose asynchronous operations on streams of values and events without many of the hazards of side effects and mutable shared state.

Functional Languages that Compile to JavaScript / Lenses

  • Fable - Compiles F# to readable JavaScript.

Programming Tools / Lenses

  • 4.5 (‚≠ê21) ‚Äì A functional assertions library. If you prefer functional style APIs and practices in JavaScript, this library aims to solve this with functionally-oriented assertions that are lazy and monadic.
  • hm-def (‚≠ê199) ‚Äì Runtime type checking for JS with Hindley Milner signatures.
entry.summary: 6 awesome projects updated on Jun 05 - Jun 11, 2017

entry.title: Awesome Fp Js Updates on May 09 - May 15, 2016
entry.content:
Libraries / Algebraic Data Types

  • immutable-ext (‚≠ê489) ‚Äì FantasyLand extensions for Immutable.js (‚≠ê33k).

Resources / Books

  • Professor Frisby‚Äôs Mostly Adequate Guide to Functional Programming (‚≠ê24k) ‚Äì This is a book on the functional paradigm in general using the world‚Äôs most popular functional programming language: JavaScript. It‚Äôs a practical introduction that builds up intuition through real-world examples. Strongly recommended. By Brian Lonsdorf (2016)
  • JavaScript Allong√©, the ‚ÄúSix‚Äù edition. Starts with as little as possible about functions ‚Äì but no less! ‚Äì and builds up towards powerful combinators and decorators. A foundational book. By Reginald Braithwaite (2016)
  • Functional Programming in JavaScript teaches JavaScript developers functional techniques that will improve extensibility, modularity, reusability, testability, and performance. Through concrete examples and jargon-free explanations, this book teaches you how to apply functional programming to real-life development tasks. By Luis Atencio (2016)
  • Eloquent JavaScript. A modern introduction to programming using JavaScript. By Marijn Haverbeke (2014)
  • Functional JavaScript teaches how to create code that‚Äôs beautiful, safe, and simple to understand and test by using JavaScript‚Äôs functional programming support. By Michael Fogus (2013)

Resources / Articles

  • FP Concepts in JavaScript ‚Äì An introduction to Functional Programming Concepts in JavaScript. Uses the Ramda library to teach the concepts of composition, pointfree style, and functors through the simplest of examples.
  • Functional programming with JavaScript ‚Äì Another introduction to Functional Programming in JavaScript with a focus on three key themes: computation as the application of functions, statelessness, avoiding side effects.
  • A gentle introduction to functional JavaScript ‚Äì A four-part series introduction functional programming in JavaScript that gets you up to speed what all the hype about functional programming is all about.
  • Why Curry Helps ‚Äì A short overview of how to write reusable and declarative code using currying.
  • Favoring Curry - Practical applications of currying using Ramda.
  • JavaScript and Type Thinking ‚Äì Learn to reason about your JavaScript code with type thinking. Algebraic Data Types are introduced as a conceptual basis to reason about program entities.
  • Why Ramda ‚Äì To those not used to functional programming, Ramda seems to serve no purpose whatsoever. However, it does offer a different style of coding, a style that‚Äôs taken for granted in purely functional programming languages: Ramda makes it simple for you to build complex logic through functional composition.
  • Monads in JavaScript ‚Äì An introduction to the Monad design pattern in JavaScript.
  • Data Structures in JavaScript ‚Äì A series of blog posts that reimplements various data structures in JavaScript to better understand their benefits and downsides.

Resources / Videos

  • Functional programming patterns for the non-mathematician ‚Äì Learn about practical use cases for functors, applicatives, and monads.
  • Pure JavaScript ‚Äì Christian Johansen will show you how you can significantly up your game by leaving loops behind and embracing functions as the primary unit of abstraction.

Resources / Examples and Exercises

  • FPJS-Class (‚≠ê94) ‚Äì Functional Programming learned through JavaScript.
  • functional-javascript-workshop (‚≠ê2.1k) ‚Äì The goal of this workshop is to create realistic problems that can be solved using terse, vanilla, idiomatic JavaScript to teach fundamental functional programming features of JavaScript.
entry.summary: 19 awesome projects updated on May 09 - May 15, 2016

entry.title: Awesome Fp Js Updates on Apr 18 - Apr 24, 2016
entry.content:
Libraries

  • fn-curry (‚≠ê6) ‚Äì A simple function to curry a function.
  • date-fp (‚≠ê119) ‚Äì A functional utility library for working with JavaScript dates. All functions in date-fp are pure, autocurried and will not mutate the date objects they are applied to.
entry.summary: 2 awesome projects updated on Apr 18 - Apr 24, 2016

entry.title: Awesome Fp Js Updates on Mar 14 - Mar 20, 2016
entry.content:
Libraries

  • fnuc (‚≠ê16) ‚Äì A functional library for CoffeeScript (and JavaScript) to facilitate functional composition and higher order functions.
  • curry (‚≠ê85) ‚Äì Curry your functions using function bind syntax.
  • compose-function (‚≠ê56) ‚Äì Compose a new function from smaller functions.
  • functionize (‚≠ê49) ‚Äì A collection of functions which aid in making non-functional libraries functional.
  • lambdajs (‚≠ê142) ‚Äì The full ECMAScript API done a functional way.
  • fp-dom ‚Äì Making the DOM functional.
  • trifl (‚≠ê35) ‚Äì A functional user interface library with unidirectional dataflow and a virtual dom.
  • funcy (‚≠ê247) ‚Äì An experiment in adding functional pattern matching to JavaScript. Experimental üö©
  • _part_ (‚≠ê41) ‚Äì A micro library that encourages functional programming by making native methods available as partially applied functions.

Libraries / Data Structures

  • Immutable.js (‚≠ê33k) ‚Äì Immutable persistent data collections.
  • Mori (‚≠ê3.4k) ‚Äì ClojureScript‚Äôs persistent data structures and supporting API from the comfort of vanilla JavaScript.

Libraries / Algebraic Data Types

  • daggy (‚≠ê704) ‚Äì Library for creating tagged constructors.
  • Fluture (‚≠ê2.5k) ‚Äì A Future library with included control utilities, high performance and great error messages.
  • fantasy-combinators (‚≠ê66) ‚Äì Common combinators.
  • fantasy-birds (‚≠ê93) ‚Äì Port of the Haskell package Data.Aviary.Birds. Everything for your combinatory needs.

Libraries / Lenses

  • lenses (‚≠ê215) ‚Äì Composable kmett (‚≠ê2.1k) style lenses.
  • optics (‚≠ê87) ‚Äì Profunctor optics (Lens, Prism, iso).
  • ramda-lens (‚≠ê184) ‚Äì üêè üîé Lens library built on Ramda.
  • fantasy-lenses (‚≠ê109) ‚Äì Composable, immutable getters and setters. (Profunctor lenses WIP)
  • nanoscope (‚≠ê177) ‚Äì Lenses with dotty support.

Functional Languages that Compile to JavaScript / Lenses

  • ClojureScript (‚≠ê9.3k) ‚Äì Compiles Clojure, a hosted Lisp with immutable persistent data structures, to JavaScript.
  • Elm ‚Äì A type-safe functional programming language for declaratively creating web browser-based graphical user interfaces. Implemented in Haskell.
  • PureScript ‚Äì A small strongly typed programming language that compiles to JavaScript.
  • Idris ‚Äì A general purpose pure functional programming language with dependent types.
  • GHCJS (‚≠ê2.6k) ‚Äì Haskell to JavaScript compiler, based on GHC.
  • ElixirScript (‚≠ê1.6k) ‚Äì Compiles a subset of Elixir, a dynamic, functional language designed for building scalable and maintainable applications, to JavaScript.
  • Js_of_ocaml ‚Äì Compiles OCaml bytecode to JavaScript, making it possible to run OCaml programs in the browser.
  • Scala.js ‚Äì Compiles Scala to JavaScript.
  • LiveScript ‚Äì LiveScript has a straightforward mapping to JavaScript and allows you to write expressive code devoid of repetitive boilerplate.

Resources / Articles

  • Functional Programming Jargon (‚≠ê19k) ‚Äì Jargon from the functional programming world explained in JavaScript.

Resources / Videos

  • Hey Underscore, You're Doing It Wrong! ‚Äì Underscore.js claims to be a functional programming library, but is it really?

Resources / Examples and Exercises

  • functional-frontend-architecture (‚≠ê1.4k) ‚Äì A functional frontend framework. Based on Ramda¬†+¬†union-type-js¬†+¬†Flyd¬†+¬†Snabbdom
  • cube-composer (‚≠ê2k) ‚Äì A puzzle game inspired by functional programming.
  • FP Youtube Search (‚≠ê57) ‚Äì YouTube search app with ReactJS, Redux, and FP concepts
  • Hardcore Functional Programming in JavaScript ‚Äì Learn to apply techniques from the forefront of computer science research to solve practical problems in Javascript. Discover functional programming and see it demonstrated step-by-step with how to build an example web app using abstract interfaces like Monads, Functors, Monoids and Applicatives. (commercial)

Community / Related Lists

  • Awesome FRP JS (‚≠ê288) ‚Äì A curated list of awesome (functional) reactive programming stuff in JavaScript.
  • lucasviola/Awesome Functional Programming (‚≠ê984) ‚Äì Awesome resources on functional programming theory and learning materials.
  • xgrommx/Awesome Functional Programming (‚≠ê3.5k) ‚Äì A ton of articles on functional programming, as well as a huge list of functional libraries for many programming languages.
entry.summary: 38 awesome projects updated on Mar 14 - Mar 20, 2016

entry.title: Awesome Fp Js Updates on Mar 07 - Mar 13, 2016
entry.content:
Libraries

  • claire (‚≠ê78) ‚Äì A property-based testing library for clearly specifying code invariants and behaviour.

Libraries / Data Structures

  • immutable-sequence.js (‚≠ê16) ‚Äì High performance implementation of Immutable Sequence in JavaScript, based on Finger Trees (‚≠ê45).
  • Timm ‚Äì Immutability helpers with fast reads and acceptable writes.
  • Lazy.js (‚≠ê6k) ‚Äì A utility library with a lazy engine under the hood that strives to do as little work as possible while being as flexible as possible.

Libraries / Algebraic Data Types

  • union-type (‚≠ê479) ‚Äì A small JavaScript library for defining and using union types.
  • freeky (‚≠ê176) ‚Äì A collection of Free monads.

Resources / Articles

  • Functional programming ‚Äì Many articles on various aspects of functional programming in JavaScript by Gleb Bahmutov.

Resources / Videos

  • Classroom Coding with Prof. Frisby ‚Äì A series that builds a ‚Äúpractical‚Äù web application with React and functional programming in JavaScript.
entry.summary: 8 awesome projects updated on Mar 07 - Mar 13, 2016
